metadata.title: CVE-2023-20900 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A malicious actor that has been granted Guest Operation Privilegeshttps://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/8.0/vsphere-security/GUID-6A952214-0E5E-4CCF-9D2A-90948FF643EC.htmlin a target virtual machine may be able to elevate their privileges if thattarget virtual machine has been assigned a more privileged Guest Aliashttps://vdc-download.vmware.com/vmwb-repository/dcr-public/d1902b0e-d479-46bf-8ac9-cee0e31e8ec0/07ce8dbd-db48-4261-9b8f-c6d3ad8ba472/vim.vm.guest.AliasManager.html.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-20900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

open-vm-tools - 2:12.1.5-3~ubuntu0.22.04.3
open-vm-tools-containerinfo - 2:12.1.5-3~ubuntu0.22.04.3
open-vm-tools-desktop - 2:12.1.5-3~ubuntu0.22.04.3
open-vm-tools-salt-minion - 2:12.1.5-3~ubuntu0.22.04.3
open-vm-tools-sdmp - 2:12.1.5-3~ubuntu0.22.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: open-vm-tools package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:12.1.5-3~ubuntu0.22.04.3').
